tag.name: cfapplication
tag.help: Defines the scope of a CFML application; enables and disables storage of Client variables; specifies the Client variable storage mechanism; enables Session variables; and sets Application variable timeouts.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of application. Up to 64 characters

parameter.name: clientstorage
parameter.help: How client variables are stored * datasource_name: in ODBC or native data source. You must create storage repository in the Administrator. * registry: in the system registry. * cookie: on client computer in a cookie. Scalable. If client disables cookies in the browser, client variables do not work

parameter.name: setclientcookies
parameter.help: No: CFML does not automatically send CFID and CFTOKEN cookies to client browser; you must manually code CFID and CFTOKEN on the URL for every page that uses Session or Client variables

parameter.name: sessiontimeout
parameter.help: Lifespan of session variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas

parameter.name: applicationtimeout
parameter.help: Lifespan of application variables. CreateTimeSpan function and values in days, hours, minutes, and seconds, separated by commas.

parameter.name: setdomaincookies
parameter.help: Yes: Sets CFID and CFTOKEN cookies for a domain (not a host) Required, for applications running on clusters.
